p: Socio-economic status seems to play a crucial role in young adolescents during first years of university, when various studies report that the symptoms of PD are accompanied by an extreme severity. 1 Possibly, different cultural and religious beliefs seem to exacerbate painful feelings of dysmenorrhea that are exacerbated among peers of different racial backgrounds, as it is usually the case in universities. Women of families of lower monthly income present with severe menstrual pain, a fact that might be explained by the inability to seek medical attention for their condition. 1
